articles.title: US left Bagram Airbase at night with no notice, Afghan commander says - BBC News
articles.description: American troops quietly withdrew from the key airbase in the early hours, new base commander says.
articles.content:
image captionAn Afghan army soldier surveys belongings left by the US military when it departed Bagram Airbase.
The US military left Bagram Airfield - its key base in Afghanistan - in the dead of ni… [+9518 chars]

articles.title: Twitter loses immunity over user-generated content in India - Moneycontrol
articles.description: The dispute and the public spat has raised concern that American firms will find it difficult to do business amid a more stringent regulatory environment.
articles.content: Twitter Inc no more enjoys liability protection against user-generated content in India as the US microblogging giant has failed to comply with new IT rules, the Indian government said in a court fil… [+1861 chars]

articles.author: Kathy Gannon
articles.title: After troops exit, safety of US Embassy in Kabul top concern - The Associated Press
articles.description: KABUL, Afghanistan (AP) — As the end to America’s “forever war” rapidly approaches, the U.S. Embassy and other diplomatic missions in Kabul are watching a worsening security situation and looking at how to respond.

articles.title: An American lawyer went on a lunch date in Moscow. Now he's languishing in a jail cell in Belarus - CNN
articles.description: When Youras Ziankovich, a lawyer with American citizenship, returned to his Moscow hotel after a lunch date with a friend in April, he found four men waiting for him in the street.
articles.content:
